biography.value: The woeful banshee is a spiteful creature formed from the spirit of a female elf. Its face is wreathed in a wild tangle of hair, its body clad in wispy rags that flutter and stream around it.

description.value:
Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d6 + @mod type=necrotic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the banshee that can see her must succeed on a [[/save wis 13 format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A &Reference[frightened]{frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the banshee is within &Reference[line]{line} of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the banshee’s Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The banshee releases a mournful wail, provided that she isn’t in sunlight. This wail has no effect on constructs and &Reference[undead]{undead}. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a [[/save con 13 format=long]]. On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes [[/damage 3d6 type=psychic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Detect Life. The banshee can magically sense the presence of creatures up to 5 miles away that aren’t &Reference[undead]{undead} or constructs. She knows the general direction they’re in but not their exact locations.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Incorporeal Movement. The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes [[/damage 1d10 type=force average=true]] damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
